website_summaries.verdict: A Polaroid camera that works like those of yesteryear but also includes some modern technology.
pros: Reminiscent of the original Polaroid instant film camera with the bonus of Bluetooth connectivity and compatible app to make the most of your photography experience
Bluetooth allows for different capture modes
cons: May be challenging for some users to learn to use, but not for those familiar with Polaroid cameras

customer_reviews.title: Learning curve but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Ive been wanting a Polaroid camera for a while now and I finally splurged and bought this one despite the mediocre reviews. There is a learning curve but it seems all the bad reviews are just people who didn't relize how film cameras work and how sensitive they can be. It took me about one pack of film to get used to whats too much light and too little and adjusting exposure. This is my new favorite thing and i found a hobby I can stick with for a long time. (Lost a star because it did jam and I lost 3 frames from the jam and light leaks but havent had an issue since)
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Bad bad pic quality
customer_reviews.text: Pictures look just like they did 30 years ago. Maybe worse lol. My kiddos begged for this camera and have maybe taken 3-6 pics. They don’t even like it lol. My suggestion is to save your $$ and invest in something other than this. Sorry for the bad review but I think it was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Cottrell

customer_reviews.title: Modern spin on a classic camera
customer_reviews.text: Love Polaroid always have and this new camera with the ability to use your phone to have creative control is always good. I’d u are a fan of crisp digital pictures you may not be satisfied with this product. People who grew up with Polaroid and love sharing those memories will love this modern update on a classic camera
customer_reviews.author: Jason A Greenhalgh

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and fun.
customer_reviews.text: Fun new hobby. The camera is awesome, the app is great to add and do more things with. Loving this camera. Easy to use and love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Photos are TERRIBLE!
customer_reviews.text: Look at my photos and be your own judge. Every photo we have ever taken with this camera has been disappointing. Compare it with the quality of the Fujifilm Insta Mini and even though it is smaller it is much better. Maybe this is my camera but I have wasted numerous packs of film using all the different settings and none of them have resulted in better photos. The film costs way to much for this to happen...
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Absurd costumer service
customer_reviews.text: The camera is fine, not the greatest camera but it woks. Until it doesn’t anymore! After the first time I used it, it stopped working. I’ve contacted amazon costumer service and Polaroid costumer service. It’s unbelievable that after two weeks no one is able to help me and replace my camera which is under a year warranty. I cannot believe this. I want to have my camera before Christmas and yet I’m not going to have it. It’s so frustrating that I spent so much money for a gift and even with a warranty no one is able to replace the malfunction camera.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia

customer_reviews.title: Worth it if you love retro vibes
customer_reviews.text: I think this camera is great. It's my favorite birthday present. I REALLY like the double exposure feature, and the ability to control it with your phone.
customer_reviews.author: Jékksyn Ícaro

customer_reviews.title: Crapshoot on whether you'll get a decent pic
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of experience with film cameras, including various polaroid cameras (the vintage polaroid 600 SE is still my favorite). That being said, I cannot get a good photo with this camera. My little Instax camera works better. I have used two film packs and have only one perfect picture and one decent (both from the black and white pack) . None of the color film worked. Two separate film packs got jammed. I'm bummed because the picture that turned out well looks really cool, much better quality than my instax, but it's just a crap shoot on if you'll even get a picture at all.
customer_reviews.author: Seth and Maddy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing instant film camera!
customer_reviews.text: I've wanted to get into instant film after a few years of shooting digital just to challenge myself and see what all the fuss was about analog photography. This camera was an amazing introduction! Easy to use, plus, with the addition to the app, having more manual controls that let me be more creative than a normal instant film camera. Also, the new addition of an extended viewfinder makes composing this much easier than I was expecting. Can't wait to shoot more!
customer_reviews.author: John Delacruz

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was expecting but it's ok
customer_reviews.text: Love the fact that you can do many things with the camera but if you take any type of indoor pictures is very dark and looks crappy. My daughter has a Fiji insta camera and the pictures taken indoor come out better on that than this Polaroid...
customer_reviews.author: joanna

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I own a SX-70, a Polaroid Lab, a limited edition Stranger Things OneStep2. This OneStep+ is a new member of my collection. The Polaroid App adds so many more features to the camera. i-Type film has great results. Recommendation: I suggest everyone to get the Polaroid OneStep Filter Lens kit, as it can also be used as a lens cover. (I do not understand why it does not come with a lens cover)
customer_reviews.author: Wong Chun Wah

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs Up if you are able to read and understand instructions and then follow them
customer_reviews.text: Works like it's supposed to, the film it uses is way too expensive in my opinion as this was a common item way back in the day. So far I've used i-Type black and white, which had some issues with the first two and last two phots in the package so it's more than likely a fault of storage or production of the film itself. The photos that came out without blotches were very nice quality so long you do what's needed for this kind of film type. That means don't bend them, keep them face down after taking, do not wave them, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea ONeel

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced but useable and fun ✨
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good Polaroid camera. No one should have to pay more than $40-$50 for a Polaroid camera! This one cost me $120 as really the thing that adds value to it would be the Bluetooth option with an app, to give you more control if you know or learn how to shoot manual (which I know how). It should still not be this costly. The picture quality will vary depending on a LOT of things like temperature, how you stored the film, if you’re camera sliders are clean, if you’re shooting with enough light/flash, if the film is expired...it’s fun..until sometimes things go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Tano

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Nostalgia
customer_reviews.text: I'm an old soul; so holding on to one of these cameras brings me back to the days when you're able to capture the best moments with loved ones. Bring this out to a family gathering or a company party, and you are the STAR of the show. Everyone wants to use your camera and post it on their cubicles. It's a really nice icebreaker. It's not digital film, so don't expect high resolution. But there is something said for a "vintage" look; almost like looking into an old family photo album. It's timeless
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Teves

customer_reviews.title: 2 Lenses
customer_reviews.text: My friends always ask me to change my camera because i could replace it with better camera and with better lenses and i don't have to change between 2 lenses.
customer_reviews.author: GIRISH VYAS

customer_reviews.title: 8 shots, film sold separately
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorite cameras. Lightweight. Simple. The only downside compared to the originals is that you have to charge the camera since the film doesn’t contain the battery. That said, it’s probably more environmentally friendly that they don’t include a battery with every film pack!
customer_reviews.author: Saitias

customer_reviews.title: Low battery life
customer_reviews.text: I thought the battery life will last long, i was wrong. not worth it for an expensive price.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: The battery life is a joke
customer_reviews.text: I thought that this camera would be a modern version of the old one but it's essentially like a knock off of the old one. It's so difficult to take decent photos with it and I haven't been able to print a single decent photo, either. The battery life is a joke, too.
customer_reviews.author: Malakai

customer_reviews.title: Great nostalgic feeling with modern features
customer_reviews.text: This OneStep+ is even beyond better than what I expected! Very easy instructions to set up and load film. The app that goes along with it is also very easy to navigate with features like remote shutter. I haven't experimented with the double exposure or light feature yet, but I'm very excited to. It also has a really fun feature to "scan" your photos clearly so you can share them digitally. This is exactly what I was looking for in an "instant" camera!
customer_reviews.author: Augi

customer_reviews.title: Nostalgic and Fun!  ....but takes patience
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift for someone who likes to experiment with photography as a hobby. He has wanted one for a long time and loved it! The pictures have a true polaroid era look, very nostalgic. Note, the camera does not come with film. And the film is expensive. It takes a lot of patience to figure out the right exposure time and depends on the lighting. We used about 20 pictures until we were able to figure out the best setting and light to get consistent good pictures. But it has been a very fun camera to have and is a hit at parties!
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: A Classic!!
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad that I bought this. I have captured so many memories with loved ones on this and the model that comes before it. It does get expensive fast, but worth it for nostalgia and the fact the pictures are actually tangible instead of on your phone.
customer_reviews.author: Guy

customer_reviews.title: Cute!!
customer_reviews.text: I brought this for my friend for her birthday and she loves it! She had the previous version and the upgrade is so cute! She uses it all the tome when we meet up. It makes for great memories and an awesome gift! Little pricey but not too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Bayan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to start, lots of creative possibilities
customer_reviews.text: I got the One Step+ a few days before the holidays and I used it several times to take pictures that were gifted to friends. This was a lot of fun and very easy to pick up and start shooting. That being said, this is not a digital camera! There will be differences from real life and that is part of the charm. Not every photo is going to be the same, even once you learn all the quirks of your camera. I enjoyed the different features that were available to give more creative control – double exposure is so trippy. Definitely would recommend for the artsy and adventurous as well as those seeking some nostalgia.
customer_reviews.author: Alanna

customer_reviews.title: Vintage pictures meets modern technology!!
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift for christmas and I am in love! I picked it out but am sooo happy with the product and its definitely user friendly! The only thing is if they had more direction or explanation on what each camera mode does exactly or the conditions to use it in for the best quality pictures. But its amazing!! Would definitely have bought it for myself or would buy as a gift for someone who likes to take pics / likes polaroids. Its an upgrade from my instax mini 8 :)
customer_reviews.author: Miles

customer_reviews.title: Keeping it Old School
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful camera. If you know what ur doing, there is no need to go through (waste) a few polaroids before getting it down right. Pictures are really not appreciated like they were before. They just stay in ur phone. With this camera, you make memories and have beautiful polaroids to look at rather it's in a photo album, hanging on a collage you made or even on your refrigerator. Best purchase for anyone, regardless of age.
customer_reviews.author: RENEE S.

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: I made this purchase as a gift to my partner who is a professional photographer. I was told nothing but great things about the camera and how much fun it was to capture images with it. Just read the complete directions for the camera and also the directions for the film.
customer_reviews.author: Armando Cardona Jr

customer_reviews.title: I use it everywhere
customer_reviews.text: When I travel I take it, they pictures don’t always come out perfect but when it does it’s worth it, the app is easy to use as well. Being able to print out your photos right away and having the lasting memory in one photo really special.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Espinoza

customer_reviews.title: Don’t expect anything great
customer_reviews.text: Picture quality just isn’t there. 60 pictures later and I still can’t get the settings right. I tried just about every setting but couldn’t manage to get the quality of the old poloriods. I don’t want to keep messing with it because film is expensive as it is.
customer_reviews.author: Timmy Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for an old school Polaroid this is the camera. Easy to use, but you have to understand how Polaroids and instant film works. Do a little research, love this camera!
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Ungreatful son
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera for my son thinking he would think it was cool and retro but I guess I don't kow him as well as I thought I did. He said it was junk and old fashioned. I told him that it can connect to his phone, he's always carrying the darn thing with him, but he wouldn't change his mind. I guess I'll have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Ramona F

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy used
customer_reviews.text: I bought it used at “very high quality” and while the camera is in good external condition and works in almost every way the flash is entirely broken meaning I cannot take indoor photos I will be asking for my money back as a broken flash function on a camera is NOT very high quality. TL;DR don’t buy it used or at the least be ready for disappointment
customer_reviews.author: Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Sucks
customer_reviews.text: I would like to say this camera is awesome but I can't. Got it with a huge light leak going right down the middle of every picture. And trying to contact anyone about it is a nightmare. It's been 2 years of going back and forth between square trade and Amazon but I've gotten nothing. Terrible customer service. So it's getting a bad review from me.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Classic Polaroid camera
customer_reviews.text: The novelty of the Polaroid caught my 9 year old daughters attention so we got one. The picture quality is not super great, film is expensive but it is a classic camera that she enjoys.
customer_reviews.author: RNW22

customer_reviews.title: Don't know why people like it
customer_reviews.text: I always wanted a polaroid but now that I have one I can't remember why. People always said it has this unique, retro style but to me the photos just look like junk. I don't know why I bought the stupid thing, what a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Martha Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Save your Money
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes the worst pictures ever. If I could paint you a comparison to anything, I'd have to say the clarity of these pics are like looking underwater "without" goggles:-\........at night!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Powell

customer_reviews.title: Great camera.
customer_reviews.text: I love my new camera, although its not really easy for me to use my husband has to help me use and load the film, I must add I'm not that tech savy, overall I love my Polaroid original camera.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: I like it. Just read the directions and download the app. Just take your time and learn to Isengard it. But lots of film lol
customer_reviews.author: Mary Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Just like you remember
customer_reviews.text: The perfect nostalgic gift. The film is pricey but the instant gratification is worth it. Works exactly the same as the ones you remember. Haven’t used the apps much because it’s too fun to use without them.
customer_reviews.author: AJR

customer_reviews.title: broke first day
customer_reviews.text: Got through one pack of film (half the pack so defective only partial image developed). Camera broke (roller popped out) after only couple shot with 2nd pack of film. Total waste - of camera and film! Beware!
customer_reviews.author: v vadim

customer_reviews.title: Will definitely be returning this
customer_reviews.text: I got it for my daughter as she is an aspiring photographer. She wanted to try a camera that would challenge her photography skills, but this one just did not do it for her. Not only was it overly complicated, but then the photos themselves never came out good. As a result, the prints also looked pretty bad. I'll definitely be returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Talbot B

customer_reviews.title: Neck strap missing
customer_reviews.text: My order came in the mail today but of course there was something wrong with it. The neck strap was missing! How am I going to hang my favorite polaroid around my neck without a neck strap? Now I'll have to wait until they send me a strap to take pictures, I wouldn't want to drop and break it. Knowing me I probably would, all my family tells me I'm a big clutz all the time.
customer_reviews.author: warren

customer_reviews.title: I recommended
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t had the chance to use it yet forgot to get film but looks great and feels great I’m going to assume that for the price the picture quality will be pretty damn good to
customer_reviews.author: Cortlin

customer_reviews.title: Low quality pictures
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t take pictures as well as the original in the 70s
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I like the updated product from the old ones. They added a lot of cool features that aren't always intuitive. Just watch a video of it on YouTube and you got it.
customer_reviews.author: Sir Walter

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper out and doesnt include charging adapter
customer_reviews.text: They only sent a charging cable and not an adapter. Very cheap of them so thats why the 3 stars
customer_reviews.author: Amber Barringer

customer_reviews.title: Memories to last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this camera - sometimes the pictures come out a little fuzzy but the ones that come out perfect, I will cherish forever. I am the worst about printing pictures from my phone, so to have these instant and as a classic Polaroid is priceless. (Not to mention SO fun to pull out at a get together) 10/10 would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gift
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves it, but the high price for film causes him to use it sparingly.
customer_reviews.author: R K

customer_reviews.title: Recharching is impossible
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product in December as a Christmas gift. My daughter used it a few times and recently attempted to charge it and it will not take a charge. Polaroid said that since it was purchased via Amazon, they are not responsible. This is unacceptable and a pretty high price to pay for a total of 7 polaroids.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This doesn't work!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera from Amazon took two pictures on it and now it won't turn on again. I am extremely upset with this purchase and product. I have contacted polaroid and no one has helped. Overall very disappointed. Also it is very hard to get in touch with anyone who can help.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Defliese

customer_reviews.title: Just not right
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why this thing is being advertised as a new and improved polaroid. I still have my old one and it works great. This new one has something different about it that I just don't like. I can't put my finger on it but something ain't right here. Something just ain't right.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Norman

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: This was a great buy I had some connectivity issues but that was on my side and not the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after three months and the warrant was over by then.
customer_reviews.author: sandra Morgan

customer_reviews.title: It’s either crap or defective???
customer_reviews.text: No matter the setting or lighting all the pictures come out blurry. Wife and I have worked in the field of photography for 20 years and this camera doesn’t take a clear picture. Perhaps the one we received is defective...
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Dunlap

customer_reviews.title: No Headline Needed
customer_reviews.text: No expectations needed. Everything you want in a Polaroid is right here.
customer_reviews.author: Chair

customer_reviews.title: Takes a while to take a decent photo
customer_reviews.text: I didn't find this camera as easy to use as I had expected it to, which causes me to take a lot of time in order to take a decent photo.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell R Beckwith

customer_reviews.title: Grandfather and I were disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my grandfather for his birthday to remind him of the old cameras that he's used but we were both pretty disappointed. The photos didn't come out well and the prints weren't any better. The battery life is not great, either.
customer_reviews.author: Orson

customer_reviews.title: A+
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. Cute and nostalgic. Very simple. Great gift for teens.
customer_reviews.author: Athena Jones

customer_reviews.title: bad picture quality
customer_reviews.text: I thought Polaroid would have made some improvements to their cameras by now but it turns out that the picture quality is just as plain and uninspired as it was thirty years ago. The app features are cool but it's pretty worthless if the picture quality is poor. Not a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ada Briggs

customer_reviews.title: It is huge and heavy
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for an instant print camera that you can carry around with you, I would suggest running as far away as you can from this one because it is huge and heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Polaroid came in broken
customer_reviews.text: Polaroid came in broken. Charged it for a day but the LED was not turning red which indicates it’s not even charging. Followed the instructional video and the instructions but was just not working. Returning the product ASAP
customer_reviews.author: Armando

customer_reviews.title: Won't sync with phone
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera but it won't sync with my iphone. I don't know what the problem is but it's a major inconveniece for me. I guess I'll have to send it in to get fixed. That means at least a week without a camera and I don't know if I can do that.
customer_reviews.author: Hazel

customer_reviews.title: Good memories comes
customer_reviews.text: I love it!!! The pictures are awesome and took me back when I was a kid
customer_reviews.author: Pepe

customer_reviews.title: Really great camera and film!
customer_reviews.text: Using my Polaroid original gives me a sense of nostalgia, and a real picture to hold on too. I am able to use my phone as light effects in the background, film is easy to replace. Easy and fun to use, I can post a real picture in the office and at home.
customer_reviews.author: s_daily359

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Love this Polaroid! Brings me back in time while keeping me up to date, at the same time! It does take a bit to learn how to shoot with different lighting (outside/inside/lights on/off). The booklet helps a lot as well as reading reviews! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: It's like being a kid again with new super cool features!
customer_reviews.author: Akalei

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pictures
customer_reviews.text: Totally liked this camera. It takes much better pictures than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: thoms e calderone

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth Polaroid camera
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in the Bluetooth Camera really doesn’t have much of a difference from the regular one. Only difference is that you can control camera with your phone Not really worth the extra $60
customer_reviews.author: robert tafolla

customer_reviews.title: All the pictures are blurry
customer_reviews.text: All the pictures are blurry. But it’s easy to use and fun.
customer_reviews.author: Ty Burke

customer_reviews.title: Shutter button broke
customer_reviews.text: So I got this camera because I'm a big fan of the polaroid brand but the shutter button wouldn't work. It seems to be stuck in the down position. How annoying to get a new camera and the stupid thing doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Claire_wong

customer_reviews.title: lame
customer_reviews.text: Unlike other instant print cameras these days, this polaroid is still very large. It's so big you have to wear a neck strap with the thing. I don't know why I bought it but I'm sending it back right away.
customer_reviews.author: Louise Richards

customer_reviews.title: Same boring old camera
customer_reviews.text: What an old and antiquated camera. It's just like the old polaroid but with bluetooth ability. How boring. I thought the folks at polaroid could be more creative in camera development. I guess I was wrong.
customer_reviews.author: marta

customer_reviews.title: Just like the ole days!
customer_reviews.text: Was a gift. Should include photo paper first time. Other than that, great product.
customer_reviews.author: Thor

customer_reviews.title: Ughhhh
customer_reviews.text: I literally just opened it and it’s not printing the pictures. Followed all the instructions step by step, let it charge and still nothing. I’m gonna buy a new pack of film and see if it’s a defective pack then I’ll come back and change my review
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Egan

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love it, it’s like old times, didn’t figure it out yet but still love it
customer_reviews.author: Bela_K

customer_reviews.title: waste of money
customer_reviews.text: dont waste your money just stick to Iphone. I spent about $100 on film most pictures did not come out right either to dark or super bright
customer_reviews.author: rich

customer_reviews.title: It is only compatible with two types of film
customer_reviews.text: Since this instant print camera is only compatible with two types of film, it makes it very difficult and expensive to print with it.
customer_reviews.author: charles mullins

customer_reviews.title: no go camera
customer_reviews.text: I love a good polaroid but this camera is too modern for me. I like to keep it old school, and if the camera can link to a device or be used with an app or something like that it's an automatic no go for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette

customer_reviews.title: Love it so much!
customer_reviews.text: Im in love with this camera! It quickly became my best friend at any special ocation! 🥰
customer_reviews.author: Marcelo Moriel

customer_reviews.title: Return it
customer_reviews.text: The camera is okay but the film cost quite a lot actually. I don't know how I'm going to afford buying such expensive film all the time. I'll probably just return the thing for a refund soon.
customer_reviews.author: K Wilson

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC
customer_reviews.text: Great for photos and the whole picture that I have taken really come out looking amazing,
customer_reviews.author: Aaron cash

customer_reviews.title: The bluetooth feature isn't great
customer_reviews.text: Since I can connect my device to this camera via bluetooth, I can control it from afar, however, the signal is very poor. They definitely did not do enough work on the Bluetooth feature.
customer_reviews.author: Fransisco

customer_reviews.title: Trying to connect to it is a nightmare
customer_reviews.text: I really don't like the app that comes with this instant print camera and trying to connect to it is a nightmare, too.
customer_reviews.author: Smith T

customer_reviews.title: I had a lot of issues connecting to this camera
customer_reviews.text: I found the Bluetooth function of this instant print camera to be very problematic as I had a lot of issues connecting to it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Amazing modernization of a vintage treausre
customer_reviews.text: The camera has excellent photo quality, with two modes for both regular landscape photos and an option for close-up portraits. Camera works with both classic 600 film and i Type. The only downside being- I CANT FIND THE APP ANYWHERE (iTunes App Store) !!!
customer_reviews.author: EKenny

customer_reviews.title: All around disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have so many issues with this camera. First of all, the noise trigger is really annoying. I don't even know why they bothered with it. Also, the manual control is not easy to use on the app. I also had so many connectivity issues with the app. I'm just all around disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Luciano Pickard

customer_reviews.title: very cute and convenient
customer_reviews.text: a little annoying that it was almost $130 and not one piece of film included also it was very hard to get the straps on
customer_reviews.author: Juliec9

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it as a gift and my brother loved it! Great condition and quality. Totally worth the money. Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Good buy.
customer_reviews.text: Love my camera, it took time to learn how to use but it makes taking photos somewhat more meaningful given that there’s just one copy. Film is expensive, but I’m sold that it’s worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dark, blurry photos
customer_reviews.text: This take awful photos despite being in great outdoor lighting...maybe I need a lesson, I don’t know
customer_reviews.author: Sarlex Koberlein

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Got myself one and gave one out as a gift. They liked it too. Bluetooth connection is a major good point. It was a little bit confusing at the beginning but you'll get around it after taking a few test shots.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Junky and old
customer_reviews.text: This camera is too big and bulky. I need an instant print camera that fits in my jean pocket, not one that I have to hang around my neck like an amulet. What an old piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Clelia Bunn

customer_reviews.title: The battery life isn't great
customer_reviews.text: I'm not impressed with the battery life of this Polaroid original as it doesn't last long during trips causing me to constantly worry about the battery dying!
customer_reviews.author: Knox Ragan

customer_reviews.title: The noise trigger is annoying
customer_reviews.text: This modern Polaroid Original really tried to perserve its old characteristics such as the noise trigger, but it ended up just being a very annoying feature.
customer_reviews.author: Nevins

customer_reviews.title: Best modern Polaroid!
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera! I’ve been shooting Polaroids for over ten years and this camera is incredible! I keep in my purse for on the go photos and it never lets me down. Best used in bright light with the flash!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! My daughter is amazed by it! Couldn’t be happier! Only one slight thing, the film is expensive. But still worth it!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kim B.

customer_reviews.title: No comment
customer_reviews.text: Don't know was a gift. He seem to like it.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Bucsit

customer_reviews.title: Well built and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. Works great with 600 film and very easy to use with Bluetooth. Definitely a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: John Geiser

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite
customer_reviews.text: I just love this camera!! I really like that you are able to use your phone with it. Manual mode is where it’s at!! Double exposures are fun tooooo.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: The flash isn't powerful
customer_reviews.text: In addition to the poor battery life, the flash of this Polaroid Original isn't very strong, therefore, the shots don't even come out great either.
customer_reviews.author: Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Comes with two bad lenses
customer_reviews.text: It's nice how this camera comes with both a standard and a portrait lense, but they are horrible! It was such a letdown.
customer_reviews.author: Linn

product_meta.title: Polaroid OneStep+ White (9015) Bluetooth Connected Instant Film Camera
product_meta.description: Color:WhiteThe Polaroid one step+ is a new Analog instant camera that connects to your smartphone via Bluetooth, unlocking a world of creative photography. Use the integrated Polaroid Originals app to explore fun techniques like double exposures and light painting, take full creative control with manual mode and a remote trigger, or frame your perfect close-up with the additional portrait lens. Download the Polaroid Originals smartphone app from the Apple app store or the Google play Store.
feature_bullets: Original Polaroid Format - easy to use - 60-day battery life - powerful flash - self-timer mode
Bluetooth-connected app: full manual control - double exposure - light painting - noise trigger - and more!
Standard & portrait lenses: you can switch between two different lenses. One for portraits so you can take a photo from 1ft to 3ft. The second is the standard lens: photos from 3ft to infinity.
Compatible with I-type and 600 film.Tripod Mounting Thread:1/4 inch-20 Female

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,304 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
